meanings.definition: To turn into or treat as a commodity.
meanings.sent1: She was commoditizing her handmade crafts by selling them online.
meanings.sent2: The company was commoditizing their products to reach a larger market.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commoditizing friendship by counting social media likes seemed absurd.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, personal information is often commoditized without people realizing.
meanings.sent5: The artist feared commoditizing her unique style for mass production.

meanings.definition: To make something widely available and interchangeable.
meanings.sent1: Supermarkets commoditize fruits and vegetables for easy access by customers.
meanings.sent2: The goal of the company was to commoditize their services to reach more clients.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked about commoditizing homework to make it easier for students.
meanings.sent4: In the fast-food industry, burgers are commoditized to fit the standard taste preferences.
meanings.sent5: The fashion industry tends to commoditize trends to appeal to a broader audience.
